title: Therapeutic Diets in Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: By doing this study, researchers hope to learn how the ketogenic and Therapeutic Lifestyles Changes diets affect cognition in patients with Alzheimer's disease.
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests two dietary interventions — a ketogenic diet and the Therapeutic Lifestyles Changes (TLC) diet — to see how they affect cognition in people with Alzheimer’s disease. The study title is "Therapeutic Diets in Alzheimer's Disease" and the interventions are described as diet patterns (e.g., ~70% fat, <10% carbs for the ketogenic arm; 20–35% fat, 50–60% carbohydrate for the TLC arm). citeturn0search6turn0search4

Act: There is no drug or biologic being tested — the interventions are behavioral/nutritional (diets) with provision of an MCT supplement and micronutrients for the ketogenic arm, not an investigational pharmaceutical or monoclonal antibody. Primary outcomes measure cognitive performance (e.g., ADAS-Cog11). Because the trial evaluates non‑pharmacologic dietary interventions rather than a biologic or small‑molecule therapy or a drug intended as a cognitive enhancer, it does not fit the four drug/biologic categories provided. citeturn0search4turn0search5

Reflect: By the category definitions: disease-targeted biologic = biologic agents (e.g., mAbs) targeting pathology; disease-targeted small molecule = small‑molecule drugs; cognitive enhancer = drugs improving cognition without targeting pathology; neuropsychiatric symptom improvement = interventions for behavioral/psychiatric symptoms. This trial is a non‑drug dietary (lifestyle) intervention aimed at cognition, so it should be classified as 'N/A' under the given category list. Supporting registry and study descriptions are shown below. citeturn0search5turn0search2

Web search results / sources found (selected):
- Clinical trial listing and summary (CenterWatch) for NCT03860792, "Therapeutic Diets in Alzheimer's Disease" (ketogenic diet vs Therapeutic Lifestyles Changes diet). citeturn0search6
- Trial description with diet details (MedPath / trial record for NCT03860792). citeturn0search2turn0search4
- ICH GCP / clinical trials registry entry summarizing primary outcome (ADAS-Cog11) and diet arms. citeturn0search5
- Prior randomized trials of ketogenic diets in AD showing feasibility and cognitive/daily function outcomes (PubMed example). This supports that ketogenic diets are being studied as dietary interventions rather than drugs. citeturn0search0
- University news article describing the study rationale and logistics (KU Medical Center press release). citeturn0search7
